summary: The International Nuclear Energy Financing Act of 2025 aims to promote nuclear energy globally. It directs the Secretary of the Treasury to advocate for removing restrictions on nuclear energy financing at international financial institutions like the World Bank and the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development. It mandates the creation of Nuclear Energy Assistance Trust Funds at these institutions to provide financial and technical support for nuclear energy projects. The bill emphasizes support for technologies meeting high safety standards, countering influence from countries like Russia and China, and requires reporting on progress. It sunsets after 10 years.
